hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Momentum Divergence & Volume Dry-up
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BEAR regime, when BTC establishes a lower low in price but the 14-day RSI forms a higher low (bullish divergence), and this occurs alongside a 3-day average spot volume dropping below the 20-day median by 30%, the regime is likely transitioning to NEUTRAL, providing a long entry for a mean reversion bounce.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear regimes exhaust when selling pressure diminishes (shown by declining volume) and momentum diverges positively from price. Neutral funding rates indicate leveraged wash-out. This combination often precedes a stabilization period (NEUTRAL regime) or the early stages of a reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC price makes a 10-day lower low
BTC 14-day RSI makes a higher low than its prior low (divergence)
Aggregated exchange funding rates turn neutral (between -0.005% and +0.005%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches the 20-day moving average, or regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence > 65%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the divergence low by >3%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days without a confirmed higher high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such divergence/volume signals are followed by a continuation of the BEAR regime with price falling >15% within the next 10 days.
